stories.title: The Emscripten compiler itself has been compiled to WebAssembly

stories.text:
Apparently this EtherNet/IP protocol is all the rage in the industrial/IoT systems world. But it's closed source, requires friendship dues to get into the club and use, and most egregiously it claims to "trademark" Ethernet/IP even though there is already an Ethernet IP protocol (as in the Internet Protocol).

I'm curious if this is so great if anybody has looked into making a more standard protocol that doesn't require some single-vendor proprietary bizarrely trademarked and confusingly named thing?

There is ModBus/TCP but it's, yikes.

Anybody familiar with these things?
stories.title: OSS Alternative to ODVA's “EtherNet/IP” closed-source protocol?
Adverteering – voluntary advertising, data privacy rights, and web3

A one-ton tungsten cube was just bought by a crypto cabal for $250k

stories.text:
I've accumulated multiple macbooks of different vintages that I'd like to figure out what to do with. The issue is that they are usually not in great shape. I do have one from my wife that is in great shape, but I'm not sure how to "blank" that one before getting rid of it?

I also have a macbook pro from the prior model which has a bad screen. The keyboard is so-so, but the other parts are fine. Is this just something to give to an electronics recycling event?

Before I do anything, I'd like to make sure I'm not giving my data away.

So--what's your process?
stories.title: Ask HN: What do you do with old/damaged/imperfect MacBooks?
